result.reason: This is a known limitation of the MsTscAx ActiveX control's basic RedirectPrinters boolean — mstsc.exe uses a more advanced printer redirection pipeline that supports all printer types, while the COM control may skip network/certain driver printers; no reliable fix exists within the ActiveX API.
result.approach: Would require replacing the simple boolean RedirectPrinters with advanced RDP virtual channel configuration, which the MsTscAx COM control does not fully expose — this is an upstream Microsoft limitation of the ActiveX RDP control.

attempts.raw_output:
The issue is clear. mRemoteNG uses the `AdvancedSettings2.RedirectPrinters` property which is a simple boolean (on/off). The native `mstsc.exe` client uses more advanced printer redirection capabilities. This is a known limitation of the MsTscAx COM control when using basic settings — it may not redirect all printers, especially network printers or certain driver types. The fix would require using more advanced RDP settings or the RDP client API's printer-specific redirection properties.
